Title: 21 Charlemont
Details:
Rohan Holdings is a leader in the complex business of developing prestige offices, high quality business parks and industrial premises. With over 40 years’ experience in land acquisition, design, planning, construction and tenant fit out, Rohan Holdings have a respected proven track record of delivering projects on time, within budget and to their clients’ satisfaction.

Working in the shell of the newly completed 21 Charlemont Place Office Block, our brief was to take the “Grey Box” finish to full Landlord CAT-A standard to LEED Gold and A3 BER Rating.

Set against an aggressive time line driven by a signed single tenancy lease for the whole building, works included complete raised floor installation, soft floor finishes, partitions and ceilings, joinery and decorations. Our brief also extended the the complete M&E installations to include A/C, lighting, protective services, basement and roof plant, louvres & screening with full testing and commissioning.
Features:
Cat A Office Fitout
Extensive Green Roof
LEED Gold Certification and A3 BER
Balconies and Feature Roof Terrace

Title: Private Client
Details:
We are delighted to showcase the successful completion of a new 15k sq.ft. Corporate HQ office in Dublin’s City Centre for a Private Sonica Client, the results of which are absolutely stunning.

Our brief took the project from an existing Landlord CAT-A finish (which was fully stripped out) to their fitted out Corporate HQ in 8 weeks from commencement.

Works were undertaken in a multi-tenanted office development with continual intensive daily co-ordination with the sitting Building Management Team. Added to the time sensitive nature of the project was the Client’s “not-to-exceed” occupation date which was a key consideration in our aggressive construction programme.

Due to the high degree of cellularisation to form the various offices, meeting spaces and executive boardrooms, the mechanical scope required considerable addition to the primary Landlord ventilation provisions via. intensive upgrades, modelling and building control integration.

The project scope also included a large specialist joinery component, extensive meeting spaces with feature exposed ceilings and feature lighting throughout, bespoke reception area, feature hard and soft floorings, substantial active IT solution, a fully redundant IT backbone install to main comms room, high-end Corporate level access control and security install, A/V delivery and a full furniture installation across the complete floor plate.
Features:
Design and VE development to suit budget parameters
International collaboration with multiple project stakeholders
Co-ordination with local Team on relocation deliverables
Comms room commissioned and complete 2 weeks before handover to allow Client IT access.
Live building environment
Full M&E data & VC co-ordination

Title: Demonware
Details:
Demonware are an Irish software development company specialising in creating networking software and services for computer game development, most notably for the Call of Duty on-line game franchise. The company were acquired by US game publisher Activision Blizzard in 2007 and have offices in Dublin, Vancouver and Shanghai.

Due to the complexity of the works and the fact that the offices would remain LIVE through the refurbishment, the project was bid on a 2-stage basis with an open tender process to identify two preferred bidders followed by a post-tender interview process to select their final fitout partner. A large part of the Client Team’s decision making process also centered on input and commentary from the Contractor into the initial scheme design with recommendations on buildability and value engineering. We were suitably delighted to win out at interview stage and be appointed as Demonware’s contractor of choice – with us on board, planning for their new European HQ officially kicked-off led by international architects, Urban Agency.

The scope of works included segregation of the existing floor plate into Live / Under-Construction areas, the complete strip of the demised floor areas, full M&E, IT and A/V installation, a bespoke fabricated solution for Meeting Rooms (made from curved glass pods) and Team Huddle Rooms (machined birch faced plywood), full soft & hard flooring, extensive graphics package and the management & supervision of the Client’s furniture vendors. Of further note was the fact that the project was completed with the Client in full occupation on the 5th Floor of a multi-tenanted building.

The finished project is a fabulous addition to our portfolio of works and is a job that we are very proud to have been involved with.
Features:
Sonica PM
Full design realisation and co-ordination with International Design Team
Staff migration & move management
Full M&E and IT installations
Turnkey furniture package
Curved glass huddle rooms
Birch-faced plywood huddle pods
Exposed building structure & ceiling
Corporate signage & brand identity
Quote: I just want take a breath to let you know how happy we've been so far with how the build is being managed by your Team and with the quality of the work that is being done. Harry, Doug and Ray have been a pleasure to work with throughout these past 14 weeks. What could have been a very stressful experience for us, has turned out to be an education in how a professional renovation should run. Thanks to you and your Team for this.
Quote Attribution: Amy Smith, Business Services Manager, Demonware

Title: Hubspot
Details:
We had the tremendous fortune to meet with and work alongside our friends in Hubspot when our MD PM’d their very first Dublin office for just 8-people five short years ago.  Since then, we’ve had the distinct honour to be part of their expansion year-on-year as the Sonica Team continued to service their ever increasing head count and office space requirements.  Their growth in Dublin has been simply astounding. 
It is therefore with great pride, and shared enthusiasm for their continued future successes, that we announce the completion and launch of their new EMEA HQ in Dublin, which was opened in March 2016 with substantial (and well deserved) fanfare across the Irish media.

We look forward to working with Hubspot as their PM of choice here in Dublin, and wish them every good fortune in their fabulous new home.  #HubSpotDigsDublin
Timescale:
12 weeks Design Co-ordination, Contract Formulation & Lease Management
10 weeks Build Management On-Site
Features:
Sonica PM
Full Design Realisation and Co-ordination with International Design Team
Landlord Approval and Grant of Licence to Alter
Local Design Team Appointment & Management as Lead Consultant
Complete Project Financial Control & Package Management
Client Direct Vendor Engagement and Management
Staff Migration & Move Management
Quote: Sonica has been a phenomenal partner to HubSpot - they always keep our interests front-and-centre and are beyond timely and thorough. If you wanted a partner that can do it all and give the attention these complex fitout projects command, it is Sonica Fitout - they simply get it, and get results.
Quote Attribution: Ken Papa, Facilities Director, Hubspot Inc.

Title: Private Client
Details:
Our brief was to strip and refit the old Anglo Irish Bank space over two floors in St. Stephen’s Green House and transform it into an expansive, sophisticated, tech-savvy office for our Client’s expanded new HQ in Ireland.

Works were executed on a 10-week programme within a fully engaged, heavily trafficked, multi-tenanted building. With it’s location in the heart of Dublin’s shopping district on the iconic St. Stephen’s Green, the delivery of the finished project on an accelerated timeline formed a hugely important part of our project execution plan where the delivery / collection logistics, overall traffic management, DCC liaison, out of hours works scheduling and compliance with strict building noise restrictions all required in-depth consideration.

The Architectural Design included a substantial joinery package, multiple floor finishes, open grid exposed ceilings, extensive Client direct vend supervision and migration management. Other packages included substantial upgrades to the Mechanical, Electrical, IT and AV installations with all service works demanding a high level of co-ordinated attention to guarantee that the vision for the completed space was realised.
Features:
Large open plan spaces with extensive perimeter cellularisation.
Extensive M&E & IT package with “open grid” M&E ceiling services
Engagement of specialist contractors to facilitate works in a time restricted programme.
Co-ordination with local teams and stakeholders on relocation deliverables.
Cost and VE development to suit strict budget parameters.

Title: UDG Healthcare
Details:
Designed by RKD Interiors, our brief took the assignment from an Existing Landlord CAT-A area over 2-separate tenancies, both of which were then fully stripped back to basic shell and core structure as part of our works, to become UDG Healthcare’s Corporate HQ within a 10-week period from Commencement on site.

Works were performed unobtrusively within a fully engaged, highly trafficked, multi-tenanted building with close overlap to Campus Management, Client Stakeholders and neighbouring tenants.

Packages encompassed a sizeable stylish joinery element and complex Mechanical, Electrical & IT upgrades to service the open-plan work-space areas and segmental modular offices & meeting rooms. The main Reception features an inviting design element luring to a quirky ‘Breakout Area Canteen’ with feature brick internal facades, critall glazed screens, floating ‘wooden’ acoustic ceilings and matchless tiled flooring.

Due to the nature and scale of the sharp trapezoidal shaped walls and ceilings, paired with the diverging display of flooring and wall colours, the detailing in the Architectural packages required a Sonica level of attention to guarantee that the Architects vision for the completed space was realised.
Features:
Design and VE development to suit strict budget parameters
Comms room commissioned and complete 3 weeks before handover to allow Client IT access
Liaison and management of Client Direct vendors
Project acceleration to ensure no client ‘down-time’ and smooth, quick turn-around on staff migrations
Co-ordination with local Team on relocation deliverables
M&E and IT upgrades throughout
Turnkey furniture package
Quote: It was great to work with Hugh Ward and his team at Sonica Fitout on our new HQ in Riverwalk, Citywest. We were very impressed with the level of professionalism and attention to detail on every aspect of this project which produced a high standard of finish. Sonica Fitouts commitment to this project ensured that it came in on programme and within budget. Everyone is delighted with the final result.

Title: 3 Arena
Details:
Full D&B project from receipt of Client outline brief to final delivery and handover. Development of a central defined theme to roll out across the complete rebrand project was the key deliverable.

1672 individual ceiling suspended “Cities” in the 4th floor bar, over 2,400 individually controlled LED lights per City (and that’s just one area on one floor..!)

3m dia. “Oculus” video back-projected onto VIP ceiling – video specifically commissioned for the Kaleidoscope Bar fitout.

Fully programmable KNX Lighting system with user defined colour and dimming set points depending on event and scene setting requirements. This linked back to main venue DALI system for central control by Venue management.

Fully interactive Twitter feed linked to feature “floating Megalopolis” to allow visitors Tweet their venue experiences directly into the bars in real time.
Size: 4000m2 overall Venue Area. Works spread across three separate project sites running concurrently.
Features:
Conceptual development and full project design
GMP Contract Sum
Intricate project programming
Live venue interaction & co-ordination
Quote:
Have to say it looks absolutely incredible. Proud to have worked on such a prestigious project for such a prestigious company as
Sonica Fitout. From all at Devlin in Design. Congratulations to Sonica.

Title: Salesforce
Details:
Salesforce is the world’s leading CRM software and enterprise cloud ecosystem, their “Customer Success Platform” helps businesses grow into a more streamlined, effective and efficient organisations across sales, service, marketing and more.

The Sonica Ops Team has had the pleasure of being part of SFDC’s expansion by servicing their ever increasing head count and office space requirements for the past 3-years.  It is therefore with great pride that we showcase the latest SFDC office completion, a 15,000 sq.ft. floor plate in Central Park.

Works involved the demolition and strip out of the previous tenant’s existing fitted offices to cater for the new Salesforce remodelled floor plate layout.  The office design placed emphasis on increased Team collaboration with all new open plan workstations, meeting rooms, offices, boardrooms, flexible spaces, staff kitchens & canteen areas, breakout areas and a number of bespoke “TechForce Bars” all part of the required brief.

They have since been voted Ireland’s Best Workplace – the company was ranked No. 1 on the list of the Best Large Places to Work, a ranking based on employees’ own assessments of their experiences.
Timescale:
10 weeks Design Co-ordination, Procurement, GMP Formulation
12 weeks Build Management On-Site
Features:
Full GMP Build Delivery
Extensive Feature Joinery Package procurement
Complete staff auditorium with extensive A/V
Client Direct Vendor Engagement and Management
Staff Migration & Move Management
Quote: Just a little note to say a BIG thank you to you and all the Sonica team. It was a real pleasure working with you all. Thanks for your guidance, assistance and patience! Fingers crossed for the next one.

Title: Wipro
Details:
Since entering the Irish market in 2015, WIPRO have gone from strength to strength securing substantial projects for their ever increasing Client base. This success has been met with a rapid increase in head count and exponential office space requirement.

Having already completed over 50k sq.ft. of office space in Dublin for WIPRO since 2015, we were delighted to build upon and advance the great working relationship we had developed with both their International and Local Teams when they appointed us again as their Turnkey D&B Fitout Specialist for their new expansion offices in Ballsbridge.

Works were undertaken in a multi-tenanted office development with continual intensive daily co-ordination with the sitting Campus Management Team. Added to the time sensitive nature of the project was the Client’s “not-to-exceed” occupation date which was a key consideration in our aggressive construction programme.

Due to the high degree of cellularisation to form the various offices, meeting spaces, VC Rooms & Executive Boardrooms, the mechanical scope required considerable addition to the primary Landlord ventilation provisions via. intensive upgrades, modelling and building control integration.

The project scope also included a large specialist joinery component, exposed ceilings and feature lighting throughout, feature hard and soft floorings, substantial active IT solution, a fully redundant IT backbone install with UPS back up to main comms room, high-end Corporate level access control and security install, A/V delivery and a full furniture installation across the complete floor plate.
Features:
Sonica PM
Full Design Realisation and Co-ordination with International Design Team
Landlord Approval and Grant of Licence to Alter
Local Design Team Appointment & Management as Lead Consultant
Complete Project Financial Control & Package Management
Client Direct Vendor Engagement and Management
Staff Migration & Move Management

Title: Private Client
Details:
Sonica Fitout were contracted to completely refurbish the Ground Floor lobby of the headquarters of one of Ireland’s leading providers of wealth management and financial advisory services. Clients of this prestigious private client are used to a meticulous attention to detail and as such this was reflected in the design and level of finish expected.

The intent was to provide enclosed, private areas throughout the space with which to hold impromptu, private meetings while maintaining a bright, open and modern feel throughout. Combined with the extremely well-appointed joinery package the overall feel of the space was one of practical opulence and luxury.

The scope of works was a complete refurbishment with curved recessed bulkheads all LED backlit, stone tiling throughout, new security gates and curved glazed meeting rooms all surrounding the walnut clad lift core that integrated seamlessly with an oversized reception desk. In addition new bathroom and kitchen facilities were completed as well as all new air conditioning throughout the floor.

Following a week’s pre construction this project was delivered in 5 weeks over multiple phases keeping live access available to staff members 24 hours a day 7 days a week with minimal disruption.
Features:
Natural Stone floor
Bespoke Walnut wall cladding
Curved glazed partitions throughout
Oversized feature reception desk
Backlit feature ceilings throughout
New staff “speedlanes”
New facilities
Completely revamped AC system.

Title: SAS
Details:
SAS is a global market leader in business analytics software and services and is listed as being in the Top-100 Best Companies to work for worldwide. We were delighted to complete their prestigious new 1,300m2 HQ office in Dublin’s IFSC complex.

Works were undertaken in a multi-tenanted, fully occupied building with extensive noise restriction in place to avoid disruption to other businesses on-site.

The scope included complete demolitions of the existing floor plate with subsequent re-fit of partitions, glazing, managers offices, corporate meeting rooms, multiple floor finishes, decorations and a bespoke branding and graphics package. The brief also extended to the supply & installation of all new operator workstations, cellular office stations and boardroom furniture with completion of all M&E, IT and A/V services.

The completed project truly reflects SAS’s strong corporate identity through the entire space and we were delighted to hand over the finished article to the Client’s exacting standards and expectations.
Features:
Fully occupied Building Environment
Management of Client Direct Vend Packages
Complete M&E, IT and A/V service installations
Corporate Brand Package co-ordination & implementation
Extensive corporate office cellularisation
Quote: I can highly recommend Sonica Fit Out, their professionalism and flexible approach in challenging circumstances resulted in a smooth and timely delivery of SAS project, the entire team were a pleasure to work with.
Quote Attribution: Karen Chisman, Head of Corporate Services at SAS

Title: Calvin Klein
Details:
Calvin Klein is one of the leading fashion design and marketing studios in the world. They are a global lifestyle brand that exemplifies bold, progressive ideals and a seductive, and often minimal, aesthetic. After nearly 50 years of trading, Calvin Klein continues to be a cultural catalyst across the globe today.

We were delighted to be selected by Calvin Klein to carry out the complete relocation and fitout of their new flagship stores (CK Jeans & CK Underwear) in Irelands Premier Shopping destination, Kildare Village. Our brief was to create a completed space that combines the retail experience with the architectural aesthetic of this refined fashion collection.

Works were undertaken concurrently in both stores and included the full strip out of the existing premises with subsequent re-installation of new partitions and floor finishes, complete M&E & IT rework, co-ordination of a bespoke high-end joinery package and management of the internal and external CK signage install. In addition, the relocation to a temporary “Go Live” space while our refurbishment works were progressing (as well as relocation back to stores upon completion) also formed part of our project brief.

The finished product succeeds in promoting the Calvin Klein identity within Kildare Village and provides a top of the range retail experience for shoppers within both stores.
Features:
Extensive feature joinery package
Bespoke feature lighting installation
Full move management
Extensive floor finishes
POS selection, install and commisisoning
Construction of all fixed merchandise and sales displays
Quote: Our goal is always to create a space that combines the retail experience with the architectural aesthetic our fashion collection represents. We had the tremendous pleasure to collaborate with Sonica Fitout to accomplish this in our new Kildare Village stores - the finished results speak entirely for themselves.

Title: 100 Stephen’s Green
Details:
100 St. Stephen’s Green, a red brick Georgian located in the iconic South West corner of the Green, was originally sub-divided into six dated apartments. Sonica were engaged by property owners DAVY to develop the building into a prestigious single tenancy office above a 1 bedroom apartment in the basement.

The nature of the premises, and it’s status as a listed building, meant the project had to be handled with the utmost care. Working hand-in-hand with Neasa Donnellan Architects and Dublin City Council, each element of the build was scrutinised for compliance of FSC, DAC, heritage protection and quality.

The work scope included full glazing replacement with all new sliding sash windows with slimlite double glazed panels in keeping with the original, full facade restoration and re-pointing, roof replacement, extensive structural works, removal of the existing basement slab and replacement with complete tanking system and new drainage and fire protection to existing staircore as per current regulations.

Internally the high-end office interiors include full power and data cabling and floor boxes throughout, bespoke joinery and panelling in every space, restored original Georgian features on all floors, newly landscaped rear yard, high quality floor finishes and a luxury, own door, 1-bed 2-bath self contained apartment in the basement.
Features:
Protected Georgian structure
Hardwood sash windows with Slimlite glazing
Facade and roof restoration
Full internal strip out
Data cabling throughout to central rack location
New gas fired rad heating system
Hand made crown mouldings from sample of original
Period correct feature joinery throughout
Protection and restoration of existing Georgian features
Luxury floor finishes
Self contained apartment
Quote: With Sonica at the helm, the project ran seamlessly on-site - any unforeseen events were dealt with quickly and programme was never compromised. We were very impressed with the quality of their finishes and found the whole Company to be very well organised and efficient. We would be very happy to work with them again.

Title: City North Hotel
Details:
The City North Hotel & Conference Centre is a prestigious 4-Star Hotel located 30-mins North of Dublin City Center which offers luxury accommodation and an exquisite Ballroom for Conferences, Events and Weddings.

As part of the Hotel’s recent redevelopment, we were appointed to manage the extensive restructure of all of their main front of house Client facing spaces comprising of a new warm and welcoming Reception area, a fully refitted Hotel Bar and Lounge area, a Restaurant and an exclusive new Conference & Ballroom facility.

Works were carried out in a live working environment (the hotel remained fully functional during the refit) and was divided into multiple phases to ensure minimal restriction & disruption to guests during construction. All phases included substantial demolition works, full M&E installations, new partitions and feature ceilings, bespoke lighting with textured high-end joinery and exquisite segmented hardwood flooring.

Due to the nature of the works, the project required extensive management of multiple on-site trades and was completed against an aggressive programme to coincide with media published announcements on the rebrand and official launch date.
Features:
High-end joinery package
Exquisite segmented flooring
Management of multiple trades
Project multi-phasing
Full M&E installation

Title: RKD Interiors
Details:
RKD Interiors is a market leading interior architecture firm based in Dublin. The team, led by Justin Treacy, consists of the very best in creative Architects and Interior Designers who work collaboratively with the in-house support team of Designers, Technicians & CAD / BIM Coordinators and the wider resource and expertise of RKD Architects. At the core of their philosophy is a practical and pragmatic approach to delivering the best environments for the most appropriate capital outlay. Having worked with RKD Interiors on numerous occasions in the past, we were aware of the exacting standards that were expected from the outset on this collaboration.

The project was pitched as a real shop window fitout to showcase RKD’s standard and design capability to prospective visiting RKD Clients and we approached the project like any other: to deliver best in market product with zero defects at handover. Covering 6,000 sq ft over 3 floors, the work scope comprised of inspirational studios to the 1st and 2nd floors, with areas designated for collaboration and huddle meetings allowing the designers to get creative with a bespoke staff café, meeting rooms and social spaces based on the Ground Floor.

The overall brief was to produce a comfortable, modern and above all functional workspace with a professional design that exceeds expectations even in an area such as Baggot St. where high end eateries and businesses are the norm. One of the key features, as part of RKD interiors on-going commitment to a greener work environment, was to provide ample, secure bike storage for staff. Not only has this been achieved but it has also become a real design focal point, which upon entry sets a modern and progressive tone. Other features include the herringbone flooring which seamlessly combines durability with design, the increasingly popular crittal glazing and bespoke joinery throughout. In addition, you will find numerous design touches, as you would expect of an RKD interiors design, such as the exposed swag cabling to the lights in the cafe to give the illusion of extra height, the plywood routered RKD logo at entry with integrated shelving and the comfortable lounge located midway through the ground floor.

The project was delivered in 5 weeks following a 1-week pre-construction and mobilisation period.
Features:
Bespoke feature joinery and glazed partition packages
Numerous floor finishes running seamlessly throughout
Staff “Cafe”
Internal, secure bike park
2 floors of bright, modern studio space
M&E and IT upgrades throughout
Turnkey furniture package
Quote: Working with Sonica was a great experience. We would like to thank the team for delivering for such demanding taskmasters, for working with us to realise and achieve our design in a very tight timeframe, and for making the whole delivery process a thoroughly enjoyable and fun experience for us all.

Title: Fitter Faster Stronger
Details:
Established only 3-years ago, Fitter Faster Stronger (FFS) is now one of the leading specialist facilities in Dublin providing personal one-on-one or group training across a range of classes and exercise types, from total body strength to full metabolic conditioning.

Having successfully completed FFS’s original gym refurbishment in 2016, and due to their phenomenal expansion and growth, we were delighted to be appointed by the Management Team in FFS to develop and complete their 2nd bespoke premises inside of 18-months.  Working with Courtney McDonnell Design, we were delighted to take on the brief of creating a new space which motivates, engages and pushes personal goals to the highest level whilst also realising the strong branding the FFS model carries.

The space is divided into three main parts – the gym, utility space and break & members areas.  Works included the strip out & demolitions of the entire old premises followed by full M&E installation (to include a DMX programmable lighting system defined by gym instructors to suit mood or event), bespoke feature flooring across different surfaces, extensive landscaping works at the rear gardens to become an outdoor training area, complete joinery co-ordination of utility space and members area and a personalised graphics package to enhance the members workouts and provide guidance through the whole space.
Size: Complete Basement to Georgian Building, Lesson St.
Features:
Complete strip out of all incumbent areas
Full M&E installation with programmable DMX ambiance lighting
Bespoke feature flooring
Extensive landscaping works to external gym area
D&B joinery & upholstery package
Graphics co-ord and installation
Quote: The level of professionalism and proficiency on the first project we carried out with Sonica Fitout really impressed us, hence the reason why we went back to them for our 2nd premises. The entire fitout was completed on an aggressive timeline with multiple moving parts, but the team here at FFS are once again delighted with the finished product that was achieved, it looks awesome!

Title: Private Client
Details:
Sonica Fitout was appointed by CBRE to act as Main Contractor for the refurbishment and upgrade of this 5th floor Corporate office space located at East Point Business Park in Dublin.

The Client’s fitout requirements were driven by an internal review to develop new ways of working. The challenge was to take these findings and ideas and bring them into a layout scheme that realised all their requirements whilst also increasing headcount within the floor space. Our project brief then consisted of the demolition and re-build of the existing layouts, installation of new branded specialist joinery items throughout the floor, a vibrant colour theming and graphics package co-ordination, installation of new glazed partitions including folding walls with modifications to the existing data infrastructure and the mechanical and electrical services of the space.

The completed office space now promotes the Client’s identity and provides a new fresh working space for staff.
Features:
Extensive Feature Joinery Package
Data Infrastructure Installation
M&E Services Modification
Numerous Floor Finishes running seamlessly throughout
Corporate Signage & Brand Identity

Title: M & S Simply Food
Details:
M&S Simply Food are an off-shoot of the famous high street British multinational specialising on high quality grab-and-go ready meal ranges and every day food selections.

This project consisted of the fitout from shell and core of the new M&S Simply Food outlet in Dublin’s Heuston Train Station. Works revolved around the installation of new M&E services, flooring, internal partitions, decorations, PoS counters, feature joinery, product refrigeration, the co-ordination of Client direct vendors and the installation of internal and external corporate graphics.

A carefully considered site management & works execution plan was key to the success of the project with close co-ordination with Station management while works progressed in the busy station.
Features:
New M&E services installation
Feature joinery package
M&S corporate graphics install
Exposed ceilings throughout
LIVE station working environment
Client Direct vendor management
Quote: Just a quick note to compliment and acknowledge the efforts of your Team on the Heuston Station M&S project. These types of projects are not simple, particularly from a co-ordination view point, but your Team demonstrated professionalism and proactive thinking in dealing with any issue that arose and delivered the project on programme. It has been great working with you right through the project and we look forward to working with Sonica again in the future.

Title: Wipro
Details:
Since entering the Irish market in 2015, WIPRO have gone from strength to strength securing substantial projects for their ever increasing Client base. This success has been met with a rapid increase in head count and exponential office space requirement.

Having just completed their initial 30k sq.ft. office in Dublin’s Elm Park in 2015, we were delighted to build upon and advance the great working relationship we had developed with both their International and Local Teams when they appointed us again as their Turnkey D&B Fitout Specialist for their new expansion offices in Ballsbridge.

The brief was to capture the look and feel of what we had been previously delivered for them on the Elm Park project, but to take that blue print and move it on to the next level again – no easy task if you were to look at the completed space in Elm Park!

At 20k sq.ft. and running concurrently over two floors, works were undertaken in a multi-tenanted office development with continual intensive daily co-ordination with the sitting Campus Management Team. Added to the time sensitive nature of the project was the Client’s “not-to-exceed” occupation date which was a key consideration in our aggressive construction programme.

Due to the high degree of cellularisation to form the various offices, meeting spaces, VC Rooms & Executive Boardrooms, the mechanical scope required considerable addition to the primary Landlord ventilation provisions via. intensive upgrades, modelling and building control integration.

The project scope also included a large specialist joinery component, an extensive canteen space with exposed ceilings and feature lighting throughout, bespoke reception area, feature hard and soft floorings, substantial active IT solution, a fully redundant IT backbone install with UPS back up to main comms room, high-end Corporate level access control and security install, A/V delivery and a full furniture installation across the complete dual floor plate.

We wish Wipro continued success in their newest home and look forward to representing them again in their next round of expansions.
Timescale:
6 weeks design
4 weeks pre-con
10 weeks on-site
Features:
Sonica PM
Full Design Realisation and Co-ordination with International Design Team
Landlord Approval and Grant of Licence to Alter
Local Design Team Appointment & Management as Lead Consultant
Complete Project Financial Control & Package Management
Client Direct Vendor Engagement and Management
Staff Migration & Move Management
Quote:
The bittersweet time has come to say thank you and farewell (albeit for now!) to the formidable & fantastic team that is Sonica. We can’t thank you enough for your dedication, enthusiasm and flexibility over the last year. We have worked together through different time zones, deadlines and (at times!) style preferences to ultimately create two unique Office environments which epitomise the Spirit of Wipro.

Thanks for sharing your vision with us and for the friendship that we’ve formed.
Quote Attribution: Trish Buckley, Admin. Manager, WIPRO Europe

Title: Anya Hindmarch
Details:
Founded in 1987, Anya Hindmarch has grown into a global brand with more than 45 stores including flagship outlets in New York, London, Tokyo and LA. Known for blending wit and creativity with the finest craftsmanship and innovative leatherwork techniques, they are stocked in many of the world’s best retail stores, from Barney’s in New York to BoonTheShop in Korea.

Following receipt of our outline brief, we were appointed to create a unique, bespoke new store for the brand in Kildare Village coupled with the strip out, surrender and relocation of the existing store within the campus. The new store was a complete turn key fitout from “grey box” to open for business. The works comprised of new flooring details, changing room marketing and sales displays and complete joinery coordination as well as mechanical and electrical installation.

The completed project reflects Anya Hindmarch’s extraordinary identity with strong emphasis on minimalistic detail and a high level of finishes throughout.
Features:
Extensive feature joinery package
Stunning solid oak herringbone flooring
Bespoke glazed partition solution
M&E and IT upgrades throughout
Live Building working environment
Turnkey furniture package and Client migration

Title: Private Client
Details:
We are delighted to showcase the successful completion of a new 30k sq.ft. Corporate HQ office in Dublin’s Citywest Business Campus for a Private Sonica Client, the results of which are absolutely stunning.

Our brief took the project from an existing Landlord CAT-A finish (which was fully stripped out) to their fitted out Corporate HQ in 14 weeks from appointment.

Works were undertaken in a multi-tenanted office development with continual intensive daily co-ordination with the sitting Campus Management Team. Added to the time sensitive nature of the project was the Client’s “not-to-exceed” occupation date which was a key consideration in our aggressive construction programme.

Due to the high degree of cellularisation to form the various offices, meeting spaces and executive boardrooms, the mechanical scope required considerable addition to the primary Landlord ventilation provisions via. intensive upgrades, modelling and building control integration.

The project scope also included a large specialist joinery component, an extensive “Town Hall” meeting space with feature exposed ceilings and feature lighting throughout, bespoke reception area, feature hard and soft floorings, substantial active IT solution, a fully redundant IT backbone install with UPS back up to main comms room, gymnasium installation, high-end Corporate level access control and security install, A/V delivery and a full furniture installation across the complete floor plate.
Features:
Design and VE development to suit budget parameters
International collaboration with multiple project stakeholders
Co-ordination with local Team on relocation deliverables
Comms room commissioned and complete 2 weeks before handover to allow Client IT access.

Title: AIG
Details:
AIG Europe Limited is a provider of innovative products and services, including car, property, travel, health and identity theft insurance products to more than half of the country’s top 100 companies as well as many public and private sector organisations and tens of thousands of individuals. They are also the proud main sponsor of the Dublin GAA Team #BackingEveryStep

Working in their Irish HQ offices in the IFSC, our brief comprised of the removal and replacement of the complete existing building ventilation system followed by retro-install of a new AC system with associated architectural and electrical works. The brief also included a full upgrade of all WCs throughout the building, installation of new mechanical chilling plant at roof level, a fixed line system for roof access, Landlord common area refurbishment and a complete re-design and fitout of the 3rd Floor office space. All works were conducted within a live, fully occupied building environment.

The new office design placed emphasis on increased Team collaboration with all new open plan workstations, meeting rooms, offices, boardrooms, flexible spaces, staff kitchens & canteen areas, breakout areas and a number of bespoke “Tech Bars” all part of the required brief.

Effective use of space was an issue in the previous office so the new office was designed with ample storage capabilities to reduce clutter. The overall look and feel of the completed offices are fresh, professional and welcoming with spectacular views across Dublin city.

The whole project was completed within the agreed tender time frame of 22 weeks.
Features:
Variety of work settings and collaboration spaces
Extensive M&E Remodel & Upgrade
High quality joinery
Works in fully occupied building over 5-floor plates
Management of Client Direct vendors into master programme of works
Quote: On behalf of the PM team, I would like to convey our thanks to the Sonica team for a job well done. A special word of thanks to your Construction Manager, Ray McCaul, for his 100% commitment in achieving PC. This was a challenging project on a number of fronts and this achievement is not to be underestimated.
Quote Attribution: Allan Murphy, Director, Scott-Murphy. Client PM

Title: Sonica Fitout
Details:
We are delighted to showcase the completion of our new Head Office in Kingram Place, at the heart of Fitzwilliam Square in Dublin City Center.

Works commenced in January 2016 and were completed in a hugely impressive 5-week programme led by our D&B CM Colin Kirwan. Calling on our most trusted of trade contract partners, we have succeeded in creating what we feel is an office that’s truly worthy of the people that occupy it. It is everything we are as a Company: unique, unconventional, unexpected, refreshingly modern and forward thinking.

The fitout is nothing short of breath taking. Justin Treacy and Liat Greenhot of RKD Interiors have taken the vibrancy and energy of the Sonica brand and brought it to life with a myriad of individual features and wonderful ideas. From the floor-to-ceiling trapezoidal wall panelled boardroom to a 10m long 3-D snake bench with over 300 individually milled vertical components in the Ops Area, there is simply nothing like it in the City.

We can’t wait to show you around what is a great place to work and even better place to visit!
Features:
Unique custom made trapezoidal Boardroom wall panelling
Completely bespoke joinery throughout the entire office
Feature operator workstation desking & storage units
Wifi controlled lighting control system for user defined mood and colour settings
Extensive graphics and artwork package
Custom laid vinyl plank flooring to feature guest Reception
Complete A/V solution to Boardroom, Breakouts and Reception.
Quote: This office is our showroom, our statement of "Hey, look what we can do!" and it does that all in spades. We love seeing peoples reactions when they visit because they are just simply blown away with the ideas and concepts, the intricacies of the work and the overall finished product. In almost 20-years of fitout, I'm happy to say there is simply nothing like it anywhere else, which is what we at Sonica are all about.

Title: Ellucian
Details:
Ellucian provide the software, services and analytics needed to manage campus businesses faster, easier and more effectively. Serving 2,400 institutions in 40 countries across the globe, they selected Sonica Fitout as their partner for the fitout of their new Irish HQ in Dublin.

The project commenced with the demolition and strip out of existing finishes and M&E services on one of the upper floors of this multi-tenanted, fully occupied live building. The pre-planning and logistical management of this significant operation ran hand-in-hand with the simultaneous upfront procurement of specialist packages required for the fitout.

The intricate design of the space encompassed features on all flat surfaces, from the multi-layered flooring finishes to the varied hard and soft textures on partitions and walls throughout. The open plan desking has privacy screens and operator chairs matched with selected fabrics to accentuate the colour scheme of the Company’s brand. Ceilings were a blend of exposed concrete slabs interspersed with raft formed lay in grids to pick out areas below. A full M&E, IT and A/V brief fell under our remit with Sonica also co-ordinating the Client furniture delivery, load-out and installation.

The completed space gives staff the use of finished huddle rooms, spacious canteens and tea stations, open collaboration areas, V-Con Rooms, Exec Boardrooms and quiet cellular offices. The project was delivered on-programme and within the agreed Contract Sum. More importantly, it was a hugely enjoyable experience for us thanks to a fantastic Client that empowered their Design Team to “go big” with their imagination and trusted us to realise their vision for the completed work space.

The end product is truly spectacular, one that we are hugely proud of and delighted to show case.
Timescale: 7 weeks on-site from start to full Client occupation
Features:
Substantial feature joinery package
Acoustically rated glazed partition solution with bespoke manifestations
Complete M&E refit with Data / Active IT rewire part of brief
Multiple floor finishes, hard and soft
Co-ordination with sitting tennants and Landlord teams all through construction
Snag free hand back
Quote: A very detailed piece of work taken on and delivered against an aggressive programme driven by our Client's not to be missed occupational requirements. You guys made it all look easy.
Quote Attribution: Neil McGovern, Project Manager & Client Rep. Jones Lang LaSalle

Title: Ticket Master
Details:
Ticketmaster is the world’s largest ticket distribution company, providing event tickets for more than 10,000 Promotors whose productions range from professional wrestling matches and rock concerts to Broadway shows and operas.

Our brief was to deliver a vibrant and invigorating work space for the Company’s employees at the new Ticketmaster Ireland HQ.  The works entailed the fit-out to an existing unit which involved strip out and demolitions of the previously occupied space, the installation of all new wall partitions, floor finishes, internal decoration, M&E service installations and a complete office furniture solution.  The design of the working environment is predominantly open plan to allow for collaborative interaction and employee connectivity, but strategically placed workstations and cellular meeting spaces ensure that teams retain their structure within the overall environment.

Features of the design include a spacious staff kitchen and breakout area, a specialised digital meeting / training room, boardroom, numerous meeting rooms, a secure ticket print / store room and a reception area with “Bolon” wall and bespoke desk.  In keeping with Ticketmasters corporate brand identity, large scale graphics fill the walls at every vantage point, reinforcing the culture of the company and adding energy and colour to the space.

The project was delivered in 6 weeks following an accelerated pre-construction and mobilisation period to meet the Clients set in stone move in date.
Features:
Bespoke specialised joinery with numerous unique finishes and materials
International collaboration with Ticket Master’s overseas steering group
Corporate signage & brand identity
Management of Client direct vend packages

Title: Wipro
Details:
Wipro Ltd is a global information technology, consulting and outsourcing company with 158,217 employees serving clients in 175+ cities across 6 continents. The company posted revenues of $7.5 billion for the financial year ended Mar 31, 2015.

Following their announcement to move into the Irish market, they selected Sonica as their turn key D&B contractor for the design and fitout of their new 240-seater office in the spectacular Elm Park OBA in Dublin.

Our Design and Build brief took the project from initial space planning for Lease negotiation, to Landlord consent phase, through to detailed design, costing, planning, constructing and overall hand-back. The complete project life cycle, managed from start-to-finish by Sonica.

Works were undertaken in the top 3-floors of the OBA building with management of logistics and daily co-ordination with the sitting Building Management Team a key consideration in the development of our aggressive construction programme.

A high degree of cellularisation in forming the various manager offices, meeting spaces, huddle rooms and executive boardrooms required considerable addition to the Landlords naturally conditioned eco-building ventilation strategy via. intensive modelling and BMS integration. The project scope also included a large specialist joinery component, stone flooring, substantial active IT solution, a fully redundant IT backbone install, Comms Room UPS, digital monitoring, building security, A/V delivery and a complete furniture installation across 3-floor plates.

The project was run with fully transparent financials, with the Client retaining all expenditure authorisation throughout the build process via their internationally issued PO’s. The completed works were delivered below the original approved budget tabled at Design completion stage.
Features:
International collaboration at design phase to achieve Client design goals.
Open plan financials with project delivered on time and below budget.
Comms room commissioned and complete 3 weeks before handover to allow Client IT access.
Client direct vendors were managed into our overall programme to ensure complete co-ordination of overall project completion.
Quote: Every member of their Project Delivery Team remained a hugely visible resource to us all through the complete project life cycle and the final results speak for themselves. We cannot speak highly enough of the manner in which they completed this project.

Title: Blackrock Investments
Details:
Blackrock is trusted to manage more money than any other investment firm with over 135 teams in 30 countries sharing their best thinking to seek better returns for their clients. As the worlds largest investor, they currently manage in excess of 7,700 portfolios comprising $4.72T of assets.

Following the expansion of their Irish Team, they selected Sonica as main contractor for their office relocation project as they transferred their Dublin operation from Barrow St. to larger offices in Ballsbridge.

Our brief took the project from an empty “grey box” to their fully fitted out Corporate HQ in 14 weeks from appointment.

Works were undertaken in a multi-tenanted fully occupied building with continual intensive daily co-ordination with the sitting Building Management Team and other tenants a key consideration in the development of our aggressive construction programme.

Due to the high degree of cellularisation to form the various manager offices, meeting spaces and executive boardrooms, the mechanical scope required considerable addition to the primary Landlord ventilation provisions via. intensive upgrades, modelling and BMS integration. The project scope also included a large specialist joinery component, a bespoke reception area, feature hard and soft floorings, substantial active IT solution, a fully redundant IT backbone install, Comms Room UPS & downflow A/C, programmable SCADA digital monitoring, high-end Corporate level access control and security install, A/V delivery and a full furniture installation across the complete floor plate.
All works were completed on-time against an aggressive delivery programme and within the agreed budget parameters.
Features:
International collaboration with UK led Design Team
Co-ordination with sitting tenants and Landlord Teams throughout the construction period
Comms room commissioned and complete 2 weeks before handover to allow Client IT access.
Client direct vendors were managed into our overall programme to ensure complete co-ordination of the overall project completion

Title: Nissan
Details:
Nissan has been at the forefront of the Irish motor industry since their arrival into Ireland in 1977, a feat that is achieved by a potent combination of aggressive sales and marketing strategies coupled with an extremely strong customer service philosophy.

As part of their continual commitment to maintaining top-end customer experiences in their network of dealer garages, the Company embarked on a programme of refurbishment on four of their flag-ship premises in Deansgrange, Liffey Valley, Airside Swords and Tallaght. We were delighted to be selected by Nissan and their extended Professional Team to carry out this exciting multi-location works programme.

The works centred on the strip out and replacement of key features and finishes in the existing garages to raise their already impressive profiles. This was achieved by the introduction of a new bespoke A/V installation, a feature lighting overhaul, addition of glazed meeting rooms for customer interaction, a total hard-flooring uplift and replacement, new joinery, soft furnishings and a full redecoration to create a completely new look-and-feel.

The biggest challenge was to carry out these works, against 4-separate and standalone aggressive installation programmes, whilst the garages remained open for business during the refurbishment process.

It is a testament to the on-site management from the Sonica Operations Team that the projects were not only all completed on-time, but the positive impact achieved through the high-quality of the finished works exceeded Nissan’s initial expectations for these flag-ship finished garages.
Features:
Full strip out of existing finishes carried out inside LIVE working garages
Substantial out of hours working to facilitate Sales Operations
Co-ordination of Client direct international suppliers
Phased programming to allow staggered completion of garages
Quote: We developed a very good relationship with Sonica during the course of our recent multi-location refurbishments. We felt that the lines of communication were always open, their Team were very responsive to our various queries whilst remaining extremely flexible, but most importantly they shared our passion and commitment for the project at hand. We are simply delighted with the final product.

Title: Private Client
Details:
Our Client is one of Ireland’s leading providers of advanced information technology, products, services and business consulting expertise. They are dedicated to helping their Clients innovate and succeed through the end-to-end transformation of their business models and the application of innovative technology and business solutions.

Our brief comprised of the creation of a new customer experience room at their main operations facility in Dublin. Works were undertaken within this heavily occupied building with continual intensive daily co-ordination with the on-site Building Management Team. The existing space was previously used as a games area, the new fit-out required strip out of all existing finishes to provide a significant AV installation to the room, together with extensive modifications to the “Street” circulation and access areas. An associated AV room and Store Room was also constructed.

The finished product is a sleek modern fitout and the use of corporate colours throughout the design is a bold injection into what was previosuly a neutral space. Some highly technical features on the project included a bespoke free standing feature wall that was constructed with a steel frame and wrapped in toughened back painted glass to act as a divider in the room to separate the space. A custom built curved glass ramp was also provided and hanging feature oval lights are an uplifting addition.

The project was completed within the agreed tender time frame of 5 weeks.
Features:
Bespoke free standing feature wall
Specialist feature lighting
Hi-Tech AV interactive and communications systems
Curved glass access ramp

Title: Guinness Storehouse
Details:
Spread over 4-floors, works ran concurrently in Ireland’s No. 1 Tourist attraction – a building with 5,000 visitors daily.

Individual work areas were the Visitor Experience Center, Group Orientation area, Arthur Guinness Room, Business Center refurbishment, Project Taste Experience, Arrol Bar refurbishment, Red Jacket retail Fitout, Ground Floor signature St. James’s Gate Replica and a full mezzanine retail area re-fit.

Project Taste included conceptual “Scent Oscillator” columns, developed and designed specifically for the new Taste Experience exhibition. The main ingredients used to brew Guinness were vaporized to enhance the overall visitor sensory experience in tasting the beer.

Interactive A/V screens in The Arthur Guinness Room that speak to visitors as they pass. Screen chassis’s concealed within feature wall paneling and triggered from ceiling disguised presence detectors.

A full size replica of the iconic St. James’s Gate was installed in the main Ground Floor visitor reception area.

Restoration of historic Guinness photography for scanning and printing onto full size extended wall murals installed in the Group Reception Area.

Millwork fabricated from reclaimed sources to preserve the antique feel of several feature joinery pieces.
Size: Multiple individual work areas spread over 4-separate floors.
Features:
Multi-Trade Interaction and Co-ordination
Management of incumbent contractors within main fitout programme
Extensive OOH Works to accommodate visitor traffic
Concept Design Development
Interaction with Several Design Teams across concurrent projects
Quote: We wanted this scheme to become the best place to taste Guiness Worldwide. The outcome conceived and developed by your installation team is simply outstanding. It has exceeded all my expectations. I love Taste, but more importantly, our visitors love it.
Quote Attribution: Paul Carthy, Managing Director, Guinness Storehouse

Title: Fitter Faster Stronger
Details:
Having only formed in 2013, Fitter Faster Stronger (FFS) is now widely regarded as the pre-eminent Strength, Metabolic Conditioning and Functional Training Facility in the Capital.  Founded by Rory McInerney and Ciaran Ruddock, they have already cultivated a unique brand, a large Twitter following and a dedicated membership that has christened their training facility “The Home of Hard Work“.

As part of their expansion and continual brand development, we were hugely enthusiastic to be engaged for their gym refurbishment project on Leeson St.  With three of the Senior Sonica management staff already dedicated members of the gym, we were delighted to be able to offer some of our expertise back in return for the countless hours of training and coaching we had received from the FFS Team.

The brief was to draw heavily from the already established branding and colouring of the FFS logo, and transfer that strength of identity into the various training areas of the gym.  The results are clean, sharp surfaces throughout with extensive motivational branding & calls to action.
Timescale: The project was fully designed and off-site fabricated, assembly occurred on-site over a single out-of-hours weekend to accommodate the extensive gym class schedule.
Features:
Concept development
Design and off-site fabrication
Extensive branding and signage
Bespoke branded cabinetry and joinery
Feature Gym Flooring
Quote: The level of professionalism and proficiency astounded us on this project. The entire revamp was completed on an aggressive timeline, a 36 hour period, in order to minimise downtime for our Clients. The team at FFS are all delighted with a gym that is now more functional, but also looks awesome!

Title: Ballsbridge Park
Details:
Landlord refurbishment project to recondition the building atrium and main reception, all lift cores, common areas, bathrooms and staircores spread over 6-floors in a Live occupied working environment.

Works also extended to the complete demolition and refitting of the Ground Floor Open Plan Offices to act as the building marketing suite.
Formation of ground floor meeting rooms for anchor tenant, specifically designed for maximum privacy with increased acoustic properties.
Reflooring complete atrium with new stone tiling – all works carried out by nights to minimize disruption to existing tenants.

Installation of new enlarged multi-operator reception desk, double height feature atrium wall paneling and glazing.

Building fabric surveying and development of repair and maintenance programme.

Installation of new security speed lanes with supply of access control systems tailored to multitenant / multi-card operation.

Complete M&E brief to include all services associated with bathroom and shower upgrades, A/C to open plan offices and power upgrades to suit new tenancy requirements.
Size: Multiple individual work areas spread over 6-separate floors.
Features:
Landlord / Tennant liaison in programme development
Large proportion of works undertaken out of hours
Feature package design development with architect to align with budget provisions
Interfacing with multiple stake holders
Quote: We were very impressed by the manner in which you undertook the project and advanced your works – nothing was ever an issue, “No” was never an answer.

Title: Aspen Pharma
Details:
Design and Build project from initial space planning for Lease negotiation, to Landlord consent phase, through to detailed design, costing, planning, constructing and overall hand-back. The complete project life cycle, managed from start-to-finish by Sonica.

Open plan spaces were developed off the Client’s international office templates, with the expressed requirement to improve existing flow and promote productivity. Our designers took the starting point from a Dubai based plan and streamlined it into an improved Dublin model to achieve these goals.

Works were undertaken inside a 12-storey multi tenanted building. Management of logistics and daily co-ordination with the sitting Building Management Team was a key consideration in the development of our aggressive construction programme which was led by Client early occupational requirements.

A high degree of cellularisation in the offices required considerable addition to the Landlord provided A/C and lighting control systems. These A/C & lighting upgrades were carried out to provide local dedicated user defined control and were simultaneously linked back to the head end BMS system for Landlord energy monitoring.

The project was run as an open book Management Contract, with the Client retaining all expenditure authorization throughout the build process. The completed works were delivered below the original approved budget tabled at Design completion stage.
Features:
International collaboration at design phase to achieve Client design goals.
Open plan financials with project delivered on time and below budget.
Comms room commissioned and complete 3 weeks before handover to allow Client IT access.
Client direct vendors were managed into our overall programme to ensure complete co-ordination of overall project completion.
Quote: From initial meeting to final handback, we knew that in Sonica Fitout we had a Design & Build Contractor that could translate the multi-faceted requirements of our business needs into a single, co-ordinated and stream lined project action plan. They listened, they advised and they delivered a space that has gone way beyoned all of our expectations.
Quote Attribution: Elisha O' Keeffe, Aspen Pharma Ireland

Title: Sonica HQ
Details:
The brief was to capture the vibrancy and energy of the Sonica Fitout brand, while showcasing our talent for design and fitout.

The completed office had to deliver a working area that would encourage open collaboration between departments and provide an environment where staff could discuss fresh ideas and develop new systems.

The Company branding and instantly recognisable “Sonica Rainbow” colouring were used as the central theme in the fitout, with graphics and murals developed specifically to enhance the fabrics, wall and floor colorings used throughout.

Staff & Client individuality was celebrated with offices and meeting rooms designed with personality.

The canteen has a “Catch Phrase Wall” dedicated to valued Company friend.

The sauna styled Collab Room succeeds in forming the central hub – a place we gravitate to for both informal internal meetings and TGI Friday beers.

The Strong Room is a “Do Not Disturb Zone” where we can go to crash out a tender or just think in peace and quiet.

Our Client’s love it too – we’ve lost track of the amount of people that have called in to us, just to hang out (and to make sure they get their names onto the Sonica Tube Map!)
Features:
Sauna style Collab area
Extensive bespoke murals and wall art
Feature wall tiling and lighting throughout
Executive Boardroom with full A/V
Strong Room / Phone Free Zone for thinking.
Quote: It’s a really nice space, an office we all feel comfortable in, a place we love to work in, our home away from home.

Title: Axway
Details:
Over 11,000 Companies Worldwide rely on AXWAY for their B2B software solutions. Axway relied on just one, Sonica Fitout, for their new Dublin HQ office fitout.

Sonica appointed the Architectural and M&E Design Teams and also acted as traditional Main Contractor for the fitout with responsibility for overall design verification and certification of the M&E systems.

Works involved the full strip out of the existing floor plate in preparation for the formation of open plan offices, manager cellular offices, boardroom facilities with full A/V capability, new staff canteen, comms room, bathrooms & staff shower rooms.

Sonica also engaged a Graphic Design company to develop wall art and murals throughout the office space that reflected the Company’s vision and message.

Works were conducted on the 1st floor of Investment House in Dublin, a multi tenanted fully occupied Live office block, with all logistics for these operations managed by the Sonica Site Team.
Features:
Full bathroom and shower room installations
Extensive Graphics and Wall Art Design
Lead role in Design verification and certification
Aggressive programme delivered in a fully occupied multi-tennanted environment
Quote: To invest our time best in on our role as Client Representatives, we need a Contractor that makes the successful completion of the project their main and only focus. We get that every time we work with Sonica - it makes the whole process a pleasure for all concerned.
Quote Attribution: Andrew McCracken, Director, Jones Lang LaSalle

Title: Allied World
Details:
Since their formation in 2001, Allied World have built a reputation as a strong supplier of insurance and reinsurance solutions globally with a worldwide network of offices and a NYSE listing.

Appointed as Main Contractor, Sonica’s brief was to modernize Allied’s existing Dublin office while they remained in situ during the course of the works. The phased approach to the process involved meticulous planning with Allied’s appointed management team so that the overall programme could be broken down into daily milestones.

The scope involved increasing the level of open plan allowances in the space via. removal of existing cellular offices, M&E augmentations to supplement the additional head count, new canteen facilities, meeting facilities, floor finishes and a complete workstation package renewal.

The bulk of the works were conducted outside of normal office hours to minimize the impact to the Client’s day-to-day operations, with the Sonica Site Team delivering against every milestone in the process from start to finish.
Features:
In Depth Planning for substantial Out of Hours workscope
Upgraded M&E for increased staff head count
Re-cellularisation of Manager Offices and Meeting Rooms
Full new staff canteen facilities
Quote: You kept us informed through the whole process, we knew what was happening, when it was happening, what task was next in the chain and when it was successfully completed. We always felt like we were in good hands.
Quote Attribution: Aideen Quinn, VP for HR, Europe & Asia, Allied World

Title: SCA
Details:
Sonica acted as traditional Main Contractor for the fitout of SCA Ireland’s new offices with responsibility for design and certification of the M&E systems forming part of the overall brief.

Taken from Landlord CAT-A condition, works involved formation of open plan offices, manager cellular offices, boardroom facilities with full A/V capability, new staff canteen, post room & store rooms.

We also had responsibility for securing Landlord consent for the M&E alterations involved in supplementing and modifying the A/C and lighting control systems to suit our finalized layouts.
Features:
Buzzifelt feature acoustic attenuation
Feature graphics and wall murals
M&E Design and Build
Management of Client Direct furniture vendor
Landlord consent applications
Quote: We have been very impressed with your company’s overall professionalism from the cleanliness of the site, management of contractors, general can-do attitude and most importantly; the ahead of schedule completion of the job. The new office looks fantastic and the whole team are looking forward to moving into their new home!

Title: Cartrawler
Details:
Cartrawler provides travel-related retailers with a fully managed gateway to over 800 car rental agents at 30,000 locations in 174 different countries.

Sonica completed the fitout of their new offices in Dublin comprising cellular offices, meeting rooms, staff canteens, an All Hands Town Hall meeting area, chill out room and open plan workspace to accommodate up to 235 staff.

M&E works were carried out under a domestic sub-contract with Sonica offering a turn key project developed from initial tender drawings and specifications. Works involved supplementing the landlord A/C systems, a full data installation to a central comms room, electrical power distribution to desk mounted furniture solution and full lighting augmentation to include scene setting in selected areas.
Quote: You took the stress out of the whole process for us – the fitout was handed over as we wanted it when we wanted it.

Title: Lisney
Details:
When relocating from their home of c. 20-years on Dublin’s St. Stephen’s Green, Lisney appointed Sonica to act as their Main Contractor and Partner to deliver their modern new office space over two floors on Earlsfort Terrace.

Works involved the strip out of 2 existing floors in the building in preparation for the new office layouts. The first floor was fitted out as the Corporate Reception and Meeting space, a place for Lisney to receive their Clients, hold large meetings and conduct auctions. The second floor comprised the open plan office space, internal meeting space, staff canteen facilities, file storage and desking for 80 staff members.

Works were conducted on the upper floors of St. Stephens Green House, a multi tenanted office block, with all logistics and day-to-day site issues managed by the on-site Sonica Operations Team.
Features:
High End Corporate reception area
Stone flooring and bespoke branded joinery
Management of Client direct Furniture and A/V vendors
Aggressive programme delivered in multi-tenanted building
Quote: Your staff were exceptionally courteous to all our sitting building tenants through the whole fitout process, we hardly noticed you were even here.

Title: Apollo Aviation
Details:
Founded in 2002, Apollo Aviation Group is a multi-strategy alternative investment firm specializing in commercial aviation investing, creating and extracting value by investing in mid-life and mature commercial aircraft and engines.

Sonica were appointed as traditional Main Contractor for the fitout, which was carried out on the top floor of Connaught House, the exclusive multi-tenanted corporate HQ building off Mespil Road in Dublin 2.
With stunning views over Dublin, the works involved the complete strip out of the existing finishes in preparation for the new Apollo layouts. Several key building features were identified to be retained and incorporated within the completed office works, all others were promptly cleared in the opening days on site.

The completed offices comprise open plan work areas, cellular offices and meeting rooms, a bespoke Client reception area, staff canteen & break out area, full data rewire back to a new comms room, complete A/V & VC installation and a thorough M&E upgrade to accommodate the new layouts.

Working on the top floor of one of the most prestigious buildings in Dublin presented it’s own challenges, but through the daily co-ordination and management of works by the sitting Sonica Site Team, the project ran smoothly for start to finish. The completed office is considered by the Professional Team as one of the finest small office fitout examples conducted in Dublin in recent years.
Features:
Bespoke joinery installations to Client Reception Area & Corporate Meeting Space
Identification, retention and re-use of core building fabrics to augment the fitout
Complete M&E overhaul to suit new office layouts
Intense co-ordination with sitting Building Management through the fitout process.
Quote:
Very easy to work with and extremely professional from start to finish. Completed the job to a very high quality on time and within budget – 
couldn’t ask for any more.
Quote Attribution: Marcus Miller, VP Dublin Operations, Apollo Aviation
